On 9/10/07, hyysguyang <hyysguyang@...> wrote:

>  I do this in my da=
ily life but many friend  don't agree with me. there
>  opinion is that sho=
uld not write so much code.

Your friends have a point.

Just like everythi=
ng else, use TDD sparingly.  I understand you are
currently doing this as a=
n exercise, so it's healthy to take it to
extremes and do everything by the=
 book in order to learn, but in your
real work, use your judgment and decid=
e for yourself when you are
indeed writing too much code, in which case it'=
s probably safer to go
the usual route (get your code to work, then write t=
ests for it).

The downside of TDD is that you can end up writing a lot of =
tests for
business code that you quickly throw away and rewrite, so the amo=
unt
of churn can be quite high.

-- 
C=E9dric
